sentences.zh: 昔周監於二代，三聖制法，立爵五等，封國八百，同姓五十有餘。

translations.literal: In ancient times the Zhou observed the Xia and Shang, three sages established laws, set up five ranks of nobility, enfeoffed eight hundred states, with over fifty of the same surname.
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, the Zhou observed the Xia and Shang dynasties. Three sages established laws, creating five ranks of nobility and enfeoffing eight hundred states, with over fifty bearing the same surname.

sentences.zh: 周公、康叔建於魯、衛，各數百里；

translations.literal: Zhou Gong and Kang Shu were established in Lu and Wei, each several hundred li;
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou and Duke Kang were established in Lu and Wei, each several hundred li in size;

sentences.zh: 太公於齊，亦五侯九伯之地。

translations.literal: Tai Gong in Qi was also the territory of five marquises and nine earls.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke in Qi also held territory equivalent to five marquises and nine earls.

sentences.zh: 詩載其制曰：「介人惟藩，大師惟垣。

translations.literal: The Poetry records their system: 'The great men are the screen, the grand master is the wall.'
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Poetry records their system: 'The great men serve as the screen, the grand master as the wall.'

sentences.zh: 大邦惟屏，大宗惟翰。

translations.literal: The great states are the screen, the great lineage is the pillar.'
translations.idiomatic: The great states serve as the screen, the great lineage as the pillar.'

sentences.zh: 懷德惟寧，宗子惟城。

translations.literal: Cherishing virtue brings peace, the lineage sons are the ramparts.'
translations.idiomatic: Cherishing virtue brings peace, the lineage sons serve as the ramparts.'

sentences.zh: 母俾城壞，毋獨斯畏。」

translations.literal: Do not let the ramparts crumble, do not stand alone in fear.'
translations.idiomatic: Do not let the ramparts crumble, do not stand alone in fear.'

sentences.zh: 所以親親賢賢，褒表功德，關諸盛衰，深根固本，為不可拔者也。

translations.literal: This was to favor relatives and honor the worthy, to praise and display meritorious virtue, related to prosperity and decline, to deeply root and solidify the foundation, making it unremovable.
translations.idiomatic: This served to favor relatives and honor the worthy, to praise and display meritorious deeds, connecting it to prosperity and decline, deeply rooting and solidifying the foundation, making it unshakeable.

sentences.zh: 故盛則周、邵相其治，致刑錯；

translations.literal: Therefore in prosperity Zhou and Shao assisted in governing, bringing about the laying aside of punishments;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore in times of prosperity, Zhou and Shao assisted in governance, leading to the laying aside of punishments;

sentences.zh: 衰則五伯扶其弱，與共守。

translations.literal: in decline the five hegemons supported its weakness and guarded it together.
translations.idiomatic: in times of decline, the five hegemons supported its weakness and guarded it together.

sentences.zh: 自幽、平之後，日以陵夷，至虖阨挢河洛之間，分為二周，有逃責之臺，被竊鈇之言。

translations.literal: After King You and King Ping, day by day it declined, until it was cramped between the Yellow River and Luo River, divided into two Zhou, with the Terrace of Fleeing Responsibility, suffering the words of the stolen axe.
translations.idiomatic: After Kings You and Ping, it declined day by day, until it was confined between the Yellow River and Luo River, divided into two Zhou states, with the Terrace of Evading Responsibility, suffering the reproach of the stolen axe.

sentences.zh: 然天下謂之共主，彊大弗之敢傾。

translations.literal: Yet the world called it the common lord, and the powerful did not dare overthrow it.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the world still regarded it as the common ruler, and even the powerful dared not overthrow it.

sentences.zh: 歷載八百餘年，數極德盡，既於王赧，降為庶人，用天年終。

translations.literal: It lasted over eight hundred years, its mandate exhausted and virtue depleted, until King Nan, who descended to commoner status and ended with a natural lifespan.
translations.idiomatic: It lasted over eight hundred years, its mandate exhausted and virtue depleted, until King Nan descended to commoner status and died a natural death.

sentences.zh: 號位已絕於天下，尚猶枝葉相持，莫得居其虛位，海內無主，三十餘年。

translations.literal: Its title and position already extinguished from the world, yet branches and leaves still supported each other, none could occupy its empty position, the realm had no master for over thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: Its title and position were already extinguished from the world, yet like branches and leaves supporting each other, none could occupy its empty throne, leaving the realm without a master for over thirty years.

sentences.zh: 秦據勢勝之地，騁狙詐之兵，蠶食山東，壹切取勝。

translations.literal: Qin occupied advantageous terrain, deployed cunning and deceitful troops, nibbled away at Shandong, taking victory in everything.
translations.idiomatic: Qin occupied strategically advantageous territory, deployed cunning and treacherous troops, gradually encroaching on the eastern regions, achieving victory in every endeavor.

sentences.zh: 因矜其所習，自任私知，姍笑三代，盪滅古法，竊自號為皇帝，而子弟為��夫，內亡骨肉本根之輔，外亡尺土藩翼之衛。

translations.literal: Taking pride in their customs, relying on private knowledge, mocking the three dynasties, destroying ancient laws, arrogantly calling themselves emperor while their sons and younger brothers became marquis, internally lacking the support of flesh and blood kin, externally lacking the protection of territorial vassals.
translations.idiomatic: Prideful in their accustomed ways and relying on personal wisdom, they mocked the three ancient dynasties, obliterated ancient laws, presumptuously called themselves emperor while making their sons and younger brothers marquises, lacking internally the support of close kin and externally the protection of vassal territories.

sentences.zh: 陳、吳奮其白挺，劉、項隨而斃之。

translations.literal: Chen and Wu raised their plain staffs, Liu and Xiang followed and destroyed them.
translations.idiomatic: Chen and Wu raised their simple staffs in rebellion, but Liu and Xiang followed and destroyed them.

sentences.zh: 故曰，周過其曆，秦不及期，國勢然也。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said: Zhou exceeded its allotted time, Qin did not reach its time, such are the ways of state power.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: Zhou outlasted its allotted span, Qin fell short of its time, such are the inevitable ways of state power.

sentences.zh: 漢興之初，海內新定，同姓寡少，懲戒亡秦孤立之敗，於是剖裂疆土，立二等之爵。

translations.literal: At the beginning of Han's rise, the realm was newly pacified, same-surname relatives were few, learning from the Qin defeat of isolation, thus dividing the territory, establishing two ranks of nobility.
translations.idiomatic: At the beginning of the Han dynasty, the realm was newly pacified, same-surname relatives were scarce, learning from Qin's defeat due to isolation, thus dividing the territories and establishing two ranks of nobility.

sentences.zh: 功臣侯者百有餘邑，尊王子弟，大啟九國。

translations.literal: Meritorious officials enfeoffed as marquises numbered over a hundred districts, honored imperial sons and younger brothers, greatly establishing nine kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: Meritorious officials enfeoffed as marquises held over a hundred districts, imperial sons and younger brothers were honored, and nine great kingdoms were established.

sentences.zh: 自鴈門以東，盡遼陽，為燕、代。

translations.literal: From Yanmen eastward, reaching Liaoyang, made Yan and Dai.
translations.idiomatic: From Yanmen eastward to Liaoyang, these territories became the kingdoms of Yan and Dai.

sentences.zh: 常山以南，太行左轉，度河、濟，漸于海，為齊、趙。

translations.literal: South of Changshan, the Taihang turning left, crossing the Yellow River and Ji, extending to the sea, made Qi and Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: South of Changshan Mountain, where the Taihang turns left, crossing the Yellow River and Ji River, extending to the sea, these territories became the kingdoms of Qi and Zhao.

sentences.zh: 穀、泗以往，奄有龜、蒙，為梁、楚。

translations.literal: From Gu and Si onward, encompassing Gui and Meng, made Liang and Chu.
translations.idiomatic: From the Gu and Si rivers onward, encompassing the regions of Gui and Meng, these territories became the kingdoms of Liang and Chu.

sentences.zh: 東帶江、湖，薄會稽，為荊吳。

translations.literal: Eastward bordering the Jiang and Hu, approaching Kuaiji, made Jing and Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Eastward bordering the Yangtze and Hu regions, approaching Kuaiji, these territories became the kingdoms of Jing and Wu.

sentences.zh: 北界淮瀕，略廬、衡，為淮南。

translations.literal: North bordering the Huai banks, encompassing Lu and Heng, made Huainan.
translations.idiomatic: North bordering the Huai River banks, encompassing the regions of Lu and Heng, these territories became the kingdom of Huainan.

sentences.zh: 波漢之陽，亙九嶷，為長沙。

translations.literal: South of the Han's waves, extending to Jiuyi, made Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: South of the surging Han River, extending to the Jiuyi Mountains, these territories became the kingdom of Changsha.

sentences.zh: 諸侯北境，周市三垂，外接胡越。

translations.literal: The northern borders of the feudal lords encircled the three frontiers, externally connecting to the Hu and Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The northern borders of the feudal kingdoms encircled the three frontiers, externally connecting to the Xiongnu and Yue peoples.

sentences.zh: 天子自有三河、東郡、潁川、南陽，自江陵以西至巴蜀，北自雲中至隴西，與京師內史凡十五郡，公主、列侯頗邑其中。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven himself possessed Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, Nanyang, from Jiangling westward to Bashu, northward from Yunzhong to Longxi, together with the Capital Inner District making fifteen commanderies, with princesses and marquises having considerable fiefs among them.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor himself controlled the commanderies of Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang, from Jiangling westward to Bashu, northward from Yunzhong to Longxi, together with the Inner Capital District making fifteen commanderies total, with princesses and marquises holding considerable fiefs within them.

sentences.zh: 而藩國大者夸州兼郡，連城數十，宮室百官同制京師，可謂撟枉過其正矣。

translations.literal: The great vassal states boasted of combining provinces and commanderies, connecting dozens of cities, with palaces and officials following the same system as the capital, one might say they bent the crooked beyond what is straight.
translations.idiomatic: The great vassal states boasted of combining provinces and commanderies, controlling dozens of connected cities, with palaces and officials modeled exactly on the capital—one might say they bent the crooked far beyond what is straight.

sentences.zh: 雖然，高祖創業，日不暇給，孝惠享國又淺，高后女主攝位，而海內晏如，亡狂狡之憂，卒折諸呂之難，成太宗之業者，亦賴之於諸侯也。

translations.literal: Although this was so, Gaozu's founding enterprise left no time to spare, Emperor Hui's reign was short, Empress Gao was a female ruler holding position, yet the realm was peaceful, without worries of madness and cunning, ultimately breaking the Lü family's difficulty, completing the Taizong's enterprise, also relied on the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Although this was the case, Gaozu's founding enterprise left no time to spare, Emperor Hui's reign was brief, Empress Gao was a female ruler holding power, yet the realm remained peaceful without worries of madness and treachery, ultimately crushing the Lü family's rebellion and completing Emperor Taizong's enterprise—all thanks to the support of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 然諸侯原本以大，末流濫以致溢，小者淫荒越法，大者睽孤橫逆，以害身喪國。

translations.literal: Yet the feudal lords originally became great, but in the end became excessive through abuse, the small ones dissipated and transgressed the law, the great ones became alienated and rebellious, harming themselves and losing their states.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the feudal lords originally grew powerful, but eventually became excessive through abuse—the smaller ones dissipated and broke the law, the greater ones became alienated and rebellious, harming themselves and destroying their states.

sentences.zh: 故文帝采賈生之議分齊、趙，景帝用晁錯之計削吳、楚。

translations.literal: Therefore Emperor Wen adopted Jia Sheng's proposal to divide Qi and Zhao, Emperor Jing used Chao Cuo's strategy to reduce Wu and Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Emperor Wen adopted Jia Yi's proposal to divide Qi and Zhao, Emperor Jing used Chao Cuo's strategy to reduce Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 武帝施主父之冊，下推恩之令，使諸侯王得分戶邑以封子弟，不行黜陟，而藩國自析。

translations.literal: Emperor Wu implemented Zhu Fu's memorial, issued the command of extending favor, enabling the feudal kings to divide their households and towns to enfeoff their sons and younger brothers, without implementing promotion and demotion, and the vassal states divided themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wu implemented Zhu Fu's memorial and issued the decree of extending favor, allowing the feudal kings to divide their households and territories to enfeoff their sons and younger brothers, without implementing the system of promotion and demotion, causing the vassal states to divide themselves.

sentences.zh: 自此以來，齊分為七趙分為六，梁分為五，淮南分為三。

translations.literal: From this time onward, Qi was divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three.
translations.idiomatic: From this time onward, Qi was divided into seven parts, Zhao into six, Liang into five, and Huainan into three.

sentences.zh: 皇子始立者，大國不過十餘城。

translations.literal: Imperial sons newly established as kings, the great kingdoms did not exceed more than ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: Imperial sons newly established as kings had great kingdoms that did not exceed more than ten cities.

sentences.zh: 長城、燕、代雖有舊名，皆亡南北邊矣。

translations.literal: Changcheng, Yan, Dai although having old names, all lost their northern and southern borders.
translations.idiomatic: Though Changcheng, Yan, and Dai retained their old names, they all lost their northern and southern frontiers.

sentences.zh: 景遭七國之難，抑損諸侯，減黜其官。

translations.literal: Jing encountered the difficulty of the seven kingdoms, suppressed the feudal lords, reduced and demoted their officials.
translations.idiomatic: Jing faced the crisis of the seven kingdoms' rebellion, suppressed the feudal lords, and reduced and demoted their officials.

sentences.zh: 武有衡山、淮南之謀，作左官之律，設附益之法，諸侯惟得衣食稅租，不與政事。

translations.literal: Wu had the rebellion of Hengshan and Huainan, made the law of left officials, established the method of attaching benefits, the feudal lords only obtained clothing and food from taxes and rents, did not participate in government affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Wu faced the rebellions of Hengshan and Huainan, created the law of left officials, established the method of attaching benefits, so that feudal lords only received clothing and food from taxes and rents, and did not participate in government affairs.

sentences.zh: 至於哀、平之際，皆繼體苗裔，親屬疏遠，生於帷牆之中，不為士民所尊，勢與富室亡異。

translations.literal: Until the time of Ai and Ping, all were successors as descendants, relatives became distant, born within the curtained walls, not honored by scholars and commoners, their power no different from wealthy families.
translations.idiomatic: By the time of Emperors Ai and Ping, all were mere descendants continuing the line, their relatives had grown distant, born within palace walls, not respected by scholars and commoners, their power no different from wealthy families.

sentences.zh: 而本朝短世，國統三絕，是故王莽知漢中外殫微，本末俱弱，亡所忌憚，生其姦心；

translations.literal: And the present dynasty had short reigns, the national line was broken three times, therefore Wang Mang knew that Han was exhausted internally and externally, root and branch both weak, had nothing to fear, and gave birth to his treacherous heart;
translations.idiomatic: And the present dynasty suffered short reigns with the imperial line broken three times, therefore Wang Mang knew that Han was exhausted both internally and externally, weak in both root and branch, had nothing to fear, and gave birth to his treacherous ambitions;

sentences.zh: 因母后之權，假伊周之稱，顓作威福廟堂之上，不降階序而運天下。

translations.literal: relying on the empress dowager's power, borrowing the names of Yi and Zhou, monopolizing authority and fortune in the ancestral hall above, without descending the steps and ranks to manage the world.
translations.idiomatic: relying on the empress dowager's authority and borrowing the names of Yi Yin and the Duke of Zhou, he monopolized power and fortune in the ancestral temple above, without descending the steps of rank to govern the world.

sentences.zh: 詐謀既成，遂據南面之尊，分遣五威之吏，馳傳天下，班行符命。

translations.literal: His deceitful plans having succeeded, he then occupied the southern-facing throne, dispatched the five awe-inspiring officials, galloped through the world with imperial messengers, distributed and executed the talismans and commands.
translations.idiomatic: His deceitful schemes having succeeded, he then occupied the southern-facing throne, dispatched his five awe-inspiring officials, sent imperial messengers galloping throughout the world, distributing and executing the talismans and mandates.

sentences.zh: 漢諸侯王厥角绷首，奉上璽韍，惟恐在後，或乃稱美頌德，以求容媚，豈不哀哉！

translations.literal: The Han feudal kings curled their horns and bound their heads, presented the imperial seal and ribbons, fearing to be last, some even praised and eulogized virtue, to seek favor, how lamentable!
translations.idiomatic: The Han feudal kings curled their horns and bound their heads in submission, presented the imperial seals and ribbons, fearing to be last, some even praised and extolled virtue to curry favor—how lamentable!

sentences.zh: 是以究其終始彊弱之變，明監戒焉。

translations.literal: Therefore, examining the changes of strength and weakness from beginning to end, clearly taking warning from them.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, by thoroughly examining the changes of strength and weakness from beginning to end, we clearly take warning from them.

sentences.zh: 號諡

translations.literal: Titles and posthumous names.
translations.idiomatic: Titles and Posthumous Names.

sentences.zh: 屬

translations.literal: Category/branch.
translations.idiomatic: Branch/Category.

sentences.zh: 始封

translations.literal: Initially enfeoffed.
translations.idiomatic: First Enfeoffed.

sentences.zh: 子

translations.literal: Son.
translations.idiomatic: Son.

sentences.zh: 孫

translations.literal: Grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Grandson.

sentences.zh: 曾孫

translations.literal: Great-grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Great-grandson.

sentences.zh: 玄孫

translations.literal: Great-great-grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson.

sentences.zh: 六世

translations.literal: Sixth generation.
translations.idiomatic: Sixth Generation.

sentences.zh: 七世

translations.literal: Seventh generation.
translations.idiomatic: Seventh Generation.

cells.content: 楚元王交
cells.literal: Chu Yuan King Jiao.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Yuan King Jiao.

cells.content: 高帝弟。
cells.literal: Younger brother of Gao Di.
cells.idiomatic: Younger brother of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 六年正月丙午立，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: Established in the sixth year, first month, Bingwu day; died after twenty-three years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bingwu day of the first month in the sixth year; died after twenty-three years.

cells.content: 孝文二年，夷王郢客嗣，四年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen second year, Yi King Yingke succeeded; died after four years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's second year, King Yi Yingke succeeded to the throne; died after four years.

cells.content: 六年，王戊嗣，二十一年，孝景三年，反，誅。
cells.literal: Sixth year, King Wu succeeded; after twenty-one years, Xiaojing third year, rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year, King Wu succeeded to the throne; after twenty-one years, in Emperor Jing's third year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 孝景四年，文王禮以元王子平陸侯紹封，三年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, Wen King Li succeeded as Pinglu Marquis from the Yuan King's son; died after three years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fourth year, King Wen Li succeeded as Pinglu Marquis from the Yuan King's line; died after three years.

cells.content: 七年，安王道嗣，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: Seventh year, An King Dao succeeded; died after twenty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventh year, King An Dao succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-two years.

cells.content: 元朔元年，襄王注嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo first year, Xiang King Zhu succeeded; died after twelve years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yuanshuo, King Xiang Zhu succeeded to the throne; died after twelve years.

cells.content: 元鼎元年，節王純嗣，十六年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanding first year, Jie King Chun succeeded; died after sixteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yuanding, King Jie Chun succeeded to the throne; died after sixteen years.

cells.content: 天漢元年，王延壽嗣，三十二年，地節元年，謀反，誅。
cells.literal: Tianhan first year, King Yan Shou succeeded; after thirty-two years, Dijie first year, plotted rebellion, executed.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Tianhan, King Yan Shou succeeded to the throne; after thirty-two years, in the first year of Dijie, he plotted rebellion and was executed.

cells.content: 代王喜
cells.literal: Dai King Xi.
cells.idiomatic: Dai King Xi.

cells.content: 高帝兄。
cells.literal: Older brother of Gao Di.
cells.idiomatic: Older brother of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 正月壬子立，七年，為匈奴所攻，棄國自歸，廢為郃陽侯，孝惠二年薨。
cells.literal: Established first month Renzi day; seventh year, attacked by Xiongnu, abandoned kingdom and returned on his own, demoted to Heyang Marquis, died Xiaohui second year.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Renzi day of the first month; in the seventh year, attacked by the Xiongnu, he abandoned his kingdom and returned to the capital on his own, was demoted to Marquis of Heyang, and died in Emperor Hui's second year.

cells.content: 吳高祖十二年十月辛丑，王濞以故代王子沛侯立，四十二年，孝景三年，反，誅。
cells.literal: Wu: Gaozu twelfth year tenth month Xinchou day, King Pi established as Pei Marquis from former Dai King's son; forty-second year, Xiaojing third year, rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Wu: On the Xinchou day of the tenth month in Emperor Gao's twelfth year, King Pi was established as Marquis of Pei from the former Dai King's line; in the forty-second year, during Emperor Jing's third year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 齊悼惠王肥
cells.literal: Qi Dao Hui King Fei.
cells.idiomatic: Qi Dao Hui King Fei.

cells.content: 高帝子
cells.literal: Son of Gao Di.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 正月壬子立，十三年薨。
cells.literal: Established first month Renzi day; died after thirteen years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Renzi day of the first month; died after thirteen years.

cells.content: 孝惠七年，哀王襄嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaohui seventh year, Ai King Xiang succeeded; died after twelve years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's seventh year, King Ai Xiang succeeded to the throne; died after twelve years.

cells.content: 孝文二年，文王則嗣，十四年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Xiaowen second year, Wen King Ze succeeded; died after fourteen years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's second year, King Wen Ze succeeded to the throne; died after fourteen years with no heir.

cells.content: 孝文十六年，孝王將閭以悼惠王子楊虛侯紹封，十一年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen sixteenth year, Xiao King Jianglü succeeded as Yangxu Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; died after eleven years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's sixteenth year, King Xiao Jianglü succeeded as Yangxu Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; died after eleven years.

cells.content: 孝景四年，懿王壽嗣，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, Yi King Shou succeeded; died after twenty-three years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's fourth year, King Yi Shou succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-three years.

cells.content: 元光四年，厲王次昌嗣，五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Yuanguang fourth year, Li King Ci Chang succeeded; died after five years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanguang, King Li Ci Chang succeeded to the throne; died after five years with no heir.

cells.content: 城陽孝文二年二月乙卯，景王章以悼惠王子朱虛侯立，二年薨。
cells.literal: Chengyang: Xiaowen second year second month Yimao day, Jing King Zhang established as Zhu Xu Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; died after two years.
cells.idiomatic: Chengyang: On the Yimao day of the second month in Emperor Wen's second year, King Jing Zhang was established as Zhu Xu Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; died after two years.

cells.content: 四年，共王喜嗣，八年，徙淮南，四年，復還，凡三十三年薨。
cells.literal: Fourth year, Gong King Xi succeeded; eighth year, moved to Huainan, fourth year, returned again, total thirty-three years died.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Gong Xi succeeded to the throne; in the eighth year, he was moved to Huainan, and in the fourth year after that, returned again; he died after a total of thirty-three years.

cells.content: 孝景後元年，頃王延嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing Hou first year, Qing King Yan succeeded; died after twenty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of the Xiaojing Hou period, King Qing Yan succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-six years.

cells.content: 元狩六年，敬王義嗣，九年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshou sixth year, Jing King Yi succeeded; died after nine years.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Yuanshou, King Jing Yi succeeded to the throne; died after nine years.

cells.content: 元封三年，惠王武嗣，十一年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanfeng third year, Hui King Wu succeeded; died after eleven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanfeng, King Hui Wu succeeded to the throne; died after eleven years.

cells.content: 天漢四年，荒王順嗣，四十六年薨。
cells.literal: Tianhan fourth year, Huang King Shun succeeded; died after forty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Tianhan, King Huang Shun succeeded to the throne; died after forty-six years.

cells.content: 八世甘露三年，戴王恢嗣，八年薨。
cells.literal: Eighth generation Ganlu third year, Dai King Hui succeeded; died after eight years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Ganlu of the eighth generation, King Dai Hui succeeded to the throne; died after eight years.

cells.content: 九世永光元年，孝王景嗣，二十四年薨。
cells.literal: Ninth generation Yongguang first year, Xiao King Jing succeeded; died after twenty-four years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yongguang of the ninth generation, King Xiao Jing succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-four years.

cells.content: 十世鴻嘉二年，哀王雲嗣，一年薨，亡後。永始元年，王俚以雲弟紹封，二十五年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Tenth generation Hongjia second year, Ai King Yun succeeded; died after one year, no heir. Yongshi first year, King Li succeeded as Yun's younger brother; twenty-fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Hongjia of the tenth generation, King Ai Yun succeeded to the throne; died after one year with no heir. In the first year of Yongshi, King Li succeeded as Yun's younger brother; in the twenty-fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 濟北二月乙卯，王興居以悼惠王子東牟侯立，二年謀反，誅。
cells.literal: Jibei: Second month Yimao day, King Xingju established as Dongmu Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; second year plotted rebellion, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Jibei: On the Yimao day of the second month, King Xingju was established as Dongmu Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; in the second year, he plotted rebellion and was executed.

cells.content: 菑川十六年四月丙寅，懿王志以悼惠王子安都侯立為濟北王，十一年，孝景四年，徙菑川，三十五年薨。
cells.literal: Zichuan: Sixteenth year fourth month Bingyin day, Yi King Zhi established as Jibei King from Dao Hui King's son Andu Marquis; eleventh year, Xiaojing fourth year, moved to Zichuan, died after thirty-five years.
cells.idiomatic: Zichuan: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month in the sixteenth year, King Yi Zhi was established as Jibei King from the Dao Hui King's line as Andu Marquis; in the eleventh year, during Emperor Jing's fourth year, he was moved to Zichuan and died after thirty-five years.

cells.content: 元光六年，靖王建嗣，二十年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanguang sixth year, Jing King Jian succeeded; died after twenty years.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Yuanguang, King Jing Jian succeeded to the throne; died after twenty years.

cells.content: 元封二年，頃王遺嗣，三十五年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanfeng second year, Qing King Yi succeeded; died after thirty-five years.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanfeng, King Qing Yi succeeded to the throne; died after thirty-five years.

cells.content: 元平元年，思王終古嗣，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanping first year, Si King Zhonggu succeeded; died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yuanping, King Si Zhonggu succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 初元三年，考王尚嗣，六年薨。
cells.literal: Chuyuan third year, Kao King Shang succeeded; died after six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Chuyuan, King Kao Shang succeeded to the throne; died after six years.

cells.content: 永光四年，孝王橫嗣，三十一年薨。
cells.literal: Yongguang fourth year, Xiao King Heng succeeded; died after thirty-one years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yongguang, King Xiao Heng succeeded to the throne; died after thirty-one years.

cells.content: 八世元延四年，懷王友嗣，六年薨。
cells.literal: Eighth generation Yuanyan fourth year, Huai King You succeeded; died after six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanyan of the eighth generation, King Huai You succeeded to the throne; died after six years.

cells.content: 九世建平四年，王永嗣，十二年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Ninth generation Jianping fourth year, King Yong succeeded; twelfth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Jianping of the ninth generation, King Yong succeeded to the throne; in the twelfth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 濟南四月丙寅，王辟光以悼王子扐侯立，十一年反，誅。
cells.literal: Jinan: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Bi Guang established as Xun Marquis from Dao Wang's son; eleventh year rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Jinan: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Bi Guang was established as Xun Marquis from the Dao Wang's line; in the eleventh year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 菑川四月丙寅，王賢以悼惠王子武城侯立，十一年反，誅。
cells.literal: Zichuan: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Xian established as Wucheng Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; eleventh year rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Zichuan: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Xian was established as Wucheng Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; in the eleventh year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 膠西四月丙寅，王卬以悼惠王子平昌侯立，十一年反，誅。
cells.literal: Jiaoxi: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Ang established as Pingchang Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; eleventh year rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Jiaoxi: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Ang was established as Pingchang Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; in the eleventh year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 膠東四月丙寅，王熊渠以悼惠王子白石侯立，十一年反，誅。
cells.literal: Jiaodong: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Xiong Qu established as Baishi Marquis from Dao Hui King's son; eleventh year rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Jiaodong: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Xiong Qu was established as Baishi Marquis from the Dao Hui King's line; in the eleventh year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 荊王賈
cells.literal: Jing King Jia.
cells.idiomatic: Jing King Jia.

cells.content: 高帝從父弟。
cells.literal: Gao Di's paternal younger cousin.
cells.idiomatic: Younger paternal cousin of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 六年正月丙午立，六年十二月，為英布所攻，亡後。
cells.literal: Established sixth year first month Bingwu day; sixth year twelfth month, attacked by Ying Bu, lost heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bingwu day of the first month in the sixth year; in the twelfth month of the sixth year, attacked by Ying Bu, and lost his heir.

cells.content: 淮南厲王長
cells.literal: Huainan Li King Chang.
cells.idiomatic: Huainan Li King Chang.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 十一年十月庚午立，二十三年，孝文六年，謀反，廢徙蜀，死雍。
cells.literal: Established eleventh year tenth month Gengwu day; twenty-third year, Xiaowen sixth year, plotted rebellion, demoted and moved to Shu, died at Yong.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Gengwu day of the tenth month in the eleventh year; in the twenty-third year, during Emperor Wen's sixth year, he plotted rebellion, was demoted and exiled to Shu, and died at Yong.

cells.content: 十六年四月丙寅，王安以厲王子阜陵侯紹封，四十三年，元狩元年，謀反，自殺。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year fourth month Bingyin day, King An succeeded as Fuling Marquis from Li King's son; forty-third year, Yuanshou first year, plotted rebellion, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month in the sixteenth year, King An succeeded as Fuling Marquis from the Li King's line; in the forty-third year, during the first year of Yuanshou, he plotted rebellion and committed suicide.

cells.content: 衡山四月丙寅，王賜以厲王子陽周侯立為廬江王，十二年，徙衡山，四十三年，謀反，自殺。
cells.literal: Hengshan: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Ci established as Lujiang King from Li King's son Yangzhou Marquis; twelfth year, moved to Hengshan, forty-third year, plotted rebellion, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: Hengshan: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Ci was established as Lujiang King from the Li King's line as Yangzhou Marquis; in the twelfth year, he was moved to Hengshan, and in the forty-third year, he plotted rebellion and committed suicide.

cells.content: 濟北四月丙寅，王勃以厲王子安陽侯立為衡山王，十二年，徙濟北，一年薨，諡曰貞王。
cells.literal: Jibei: Fourth month Bingyin day, King Bo established as Hengshan King from Li King's son Anyang Marquis; twelfth year, moved to Jibei, died after one year, posthumous name Zhen King.
cells.idiomatic: Jibei: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month, King Bo was established as Hengshan King from the Li King's line as Anyang Marquis; in the twelfth year, he was moved to Jibei, died after one year, and was given the posthumous name Zhen King.

cells.content: 孝景六年，成王胡嗣，五十四年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing sixth year, Cheng King Hu succeeded; died after fifty-four years.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's sixth year, King Cheng Hu succeeded to the throne; died after fifty-four years.

cells.content: 天漢四年，王寬嗣，十一年，後二年，謀反，自殺。
cells.literal: Tianhan fourth year, King Kuan succeeded; eleventh year, second year of Hou period, plotted rebellion, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Tianhan, King Kuan succeeded to the throne; in the eleventh year, during the second year of the Hou period, he plotted rebellion and committed suicide.

cells.content: 趙隱王如意
cells.literal: Zhao Yin King Ruyi.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao Yin King Ruyi.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 九年四月立，十二年，為呂太后所殺，亡後。
cells.literal: Established ninth year fourth month; twelfth year, killed by Lü Empress Dowager, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the fourth month of the ninth year; in the twelfth year, he was killed by Empress Dowager Lü with no heir.

cells.content: 代王
cells.literal: Dai King.
cells.idiomatic: Dai King.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 十一年正月丙子立，十七年，高后八年，為皇帝。
cells.literal: Established eleventh year first month Bingzi day; seventeenth year, Gao Hou eighth year, became emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bingzi day of the first month in the eleventh year; in the seventeenth year, during Empress Gao's eighth year, he became emperor.

cells.content: 趙共王恢
cells.literal: Zhao Gong King Hui.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao Gong King Hui.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 十一年三月丙午，為梁王，十六年，高后七年，徙趙，其年自殺，亡後。
cells.literal: Eleventh year third month Bingwu day, became Liang King; sixteenth year, Gao Hou seventh year, moved to Zhao, that year committed suicide, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day of the third month in the eleventh year, he became Liang King; in the sixteenth year, during Empress Gao's seventh year, he was moved to Zhao, and that year he committed suicide with no heir.

cells.content: 趙幽王友
cells.literal: Zhao You King You.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao You King You.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 十一年三月丙寅，立為淮陽王，二年，徙趙，十四年，高后七年，自殺。
cells.literal: Eleventh year third month Bingyin day, established as Huaiyang King; second year, moved to Zhao; fourteenth year, Gao Hou seventh year, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the third month in the eleventh year, he was established as Huaiyang King; in the second year, he was moved to Zhao; in the fourteenth year, during Empress Gao's seventh year, he committed suicide.

cells.content: 孝文元年，王遂以幽王子紹封，二十六年，孝景三年，反，誅。
cells.literal: Xiaowen first year, King Sui succeeded as You King's son; twenty-sixth year, Xiaojing third year, rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Wen's first year, King Sui succeeded as the You King's son; in the twenty-sixth year, during Emperor Jing's third year, he rebelled and was executed.

cells.content: 河間孝文二年三月乙卯，文王辟彊以幽王子立，十三年薨。
cells.literal: Hejian: Xiaowen second year third month Yimao day, Wen King Piqiang established from You King's son; died after thirteen years.
cells.idiomatic: Hejian: On the Yimao day of the third month in Emperor Wen's second year, King Wen Piqiang was established from the You King's line; died after thirteen years.

cells.content: 十五年，哀王福嗣，一年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Fifteenth year, Ai King Fu succeeded; died after one year, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Ai Fu succeeded to the throne; died after one year with no heir.

cells.content: 燕靈王建
cells.literal: Yan Ling King Jian.
cells.idiomatic: Yan Ling King Jian.

cells.content: 高帝子。
cells.literal: Gao Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 十二年二月甲午立，十五年，高后七年，薨。呂太后殺其子。
cells.literal: Established twelfth year second month Jiawu day; fifteenth year, Gao Hou seventh year, died. Lü Empress Dowager killed his son.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jiawu day of the second month in the twelfth year; in the fifteenth year, during Empress Gao's seventh year, he died. Empress Dowager Lü killed his son.

cells.content: 燕敬王澤
cells.literal: Yan Jing King Ze.
cells.idiomatic: Yan Jing King Ze.

cells.content: 高帝從祖昆弟。
cells.literal: Gao Di's paternal first cousin.
cells.idiomatic: Paternal first cousin of Emperor Gao.

cells.content: 高后七年，以營陵侯立為琅邪王，二年，孝文元年，徙燕，二年薨。
cells.literal: Gao Hou seventh year, established as Langye King from Yingling Marquis; second year, Xiaowen first year, moved to Yan, died after two years.
cells.idiomatic: In Empress Gao's seventh year, he was established as Langye King from the Yingling Marquis line; in the second year, during Emperor Wen's first year, he was moved to Yan, and died after two years.

cells.content: 三年，康王嘉嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: Third year, Kang King Jia succeeded; died after twenty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year, King Kang Jia succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-six years.

cells.content: 孝景六年，王定國嗣，二十四年，坐禽獸行，自殺。
cells.literal: Xiaojing sixth year, King Dingguo succeeded; twenty-fourth year, convicted of bestial conduct, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In Emperor Jing's sixth year, King Dingguo succeeded to the throne; in the twenty-fourth year, he was convicted of bestial conduct and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 右高祖十一人。

translations.literal: Above, Gaozu's eleven.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Gaozu's eleven kings.

sentences.zh: 吳隨父，凡十二人。

translations.literal: Wu following his father, total twelve people.
translations.idiomatic: Wu following his father, making a total of twelve people.

cells.content: 梁懷王揖
cells.literal: Liang Huai King Yi.
cells.idiomatic: Liang Huai King Yi.

cells.content: 文帝子。
cells.literal: Wen Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wen.

cells.content: 二年二月乙卯立，十年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Established second year second month Yimao day; died after ten years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yimao day of the second month in the second year; died after ten years with no heir.

cells.content: 梁孝王武
cells.literal: Liang Xiao King Wu.
cells.idiomatic: Liang Xiao King Wu.

cells.content: 文帝子。
cells.literal: Wen Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wen.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，立為代王，三年，徙為淮陽王，十年，徙梁，三十五年薨。
cells.literal: Second month Yimao day, established as Dai King; third year, moved to become Huaiyang King; tenth year, moved to Liang, died after thirty-five years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the second month, he was established as Dai King; in the third year, he was moved to become Huaiyang King; in the tenth year, he was moved to Liang, and died after thirty-five years.

cells.content: 孝景後元年，恭王買嗣，七年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaojing Hou first year, Gong King Mai succeeded; died after seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of the Xiaojing Hou period, King Gong Mai succeeded to the throne; died after seven years.

cells.content: 建元五年，平王襄嗣，四十年薨。
cells.literal: Jianyuan fifth year, Ping King Xiang succeeded; died after forty years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Jianyuan, King Ping Xiang succeeded to the throne; died after forty years.

cells.content: 太始元年，貞王毋傷嗣，十一年薨。
cells.literal: Taishi first year, Zhen King Wushang succeeded; died after eleven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Taishi, King Zhen Wushang succeeded to the throne; died after eleven years.

cells.content: 始元二年，敬王定國嗣，四十年薨。
cells.literal: Shiyuan second year, Jing King Dingguo succeeded; died after forty years.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Shiyuan, King Jing Dingguo succeeded to the throne; died after forty years.

cells.content: 初元四年，夷王遂嗣，六年薨。
cells.literal: Chuyuan fourth year, Yi King Sui succeeded; died after six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Chuyuan, King Yi Sui succeeded to the throne; died after six years.

cells.content: 永光五年，荒王嘉嗣，十五年薨。
cells.literal: Yongguang fifth year, Huang King Jia succeeded; died after fifteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Yongguang, King Huang Jia succeeded to the throne; died after fifteen years.

cells.content: 八世陽朔元年，王立嗣，二十七年，元始三年，有罪，廢，徙漢中，自殺。元始五年二月丁酉，王音以孝王玄孫之曾孫紹封，五年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Eighth generation Yangshuo first year, King Li succeeded; twenty-seventh year, Yuanshi third year, guilty of crime, abolished, moved to Hanzhong, committed suicide. Yuanshi fifth year second month Dingyou day, King Yin succeeded as Xiao King Xuansun's great-grandson; fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yangshuo of the eighth generation, King Li succeeded to the throne; in the twenty-seventh year, during the third year of Yuanshi, he was found guilty of a crime, abolished as king, exiled to Hanzhong, and committed suicide. On the Dingyou day of the second month in the fifth year of Yuanshi, King Yin succeeded as the great-grandson of Xiao King Xuansun; in the fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 濟川孝景中六年五月丙戌，王明以孝王子桓邑侯立，七年，建元三年，坐殺中傅，廢遷房陵。
cells.literal: Jichuan: Xiaojing middle sixth year fifth month Bingxu day, King Ming established as Huanyi Marquis from Xiao King's son; seventh year, Jianyuan third year, convicted of killing the tutor, abolished and moved to Fangling.
cells.idiomatic: Jichuan: On the Bingxu day of the fifth month in the middle sixth year of Emperor Jing, King Ming was established as Huanyi Marquis from the Xiao King's line; in the seventh year, during the third year of Jianyuan, he was convicted of killing the imperial tutor, abolished as king, and exiled to Fangling.

cells.content: 濟東五月丙戌，王彭離以孝王子立，二十九年，坐殺人，廢遷上庸。
cells.literal: Jidong: Fifth month Bingxu day, King Pengli established from Xiao King's son; twenty-ninth year, convicted of murder, abolished and moved to Shangyong.
cells.idiomatic: Jidong: On the Bingxu day of the fifth month, King Pengli was established from the Xiao King's line; in the twenty-ninth year, he was convicted of murder, abolished as king, and exiled to Shangyong.

cells.content: 山陽五月丙戌，哀王定以孝王子立，九年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Shanyang: Fifth month Bingxu day, Ai King Ding established from Xiao King's son; died after nine years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Shanyang: On the Bingxu day of the fifth month, King Ai Ding was established from the Xiao King's line; died after nine years with no heir.

cells.content: 濟陰五月丙戌，哀王不識以孝王子立，二年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Jiyin: Fifth month Bingxu day, Ai King Bushi established from Xiao King's son; died after two years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Jiyin: On the Bingxu day of the fifth month, King Ai Bushi was established from the Xiao King's line; died after two years with no heir.

cells.content: 代孝王參
cells.literal: Dai Xiao King Shen.
cells.idiomatic: Dai Xiao King Shen.

cells.content: 文帝子。
cells.literal: Wen Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wen.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，立為太原王，三年，更為代王，七年薨。
cells.literal: Second month Yimao day, established as Taiyuan King; third year, changed to Dai King, died after seven years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the second month, he was established as Taiyuan King; in the third year, he was changed to Dai King, and died after seven years.

cells.content: 孝文後三年，恭王登嗣，二十九年薨。
cells.literal: Xiaowen Hou third year, Gong King Deng succeeded; died after twenty-nine years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of the Xiaowen Hou period, King Gong Deng succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-nine years.

cells.content: 清河元光三年，剛王義嗣，十九年，元鼎三年，徙清河，三十八年薨。
cells.literal: Qinghe: Yuanguang third year, Gang King Yi succeeded; nineteenth year, Yuanding third year, moved to Qinghe, died after thirty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: Qinghe: In the third year of Yuanguang, King Gang Yi succeeded to the throne; in the nineteenth year, during the third year of Yuanding, he was moved to Qinghe, and died after thirty-eight years.

cells.content: 太始三年，頃王陽嗣，二十五年薨。
cells.literal: Taishi third year, Qing King Yang succeeded; died after twenty-five years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Taishi, King Qing Yang succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-five years.

cells.content: 地節元年，王年嗣，四年，坐與同產妹姦，廢遷房陵，與邑百家。
cells.literal: Dijie first year, King Nian succeeded; fourth year, convicted of incest with full sister, abolished and moved to Fangling, given one hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Dijie, King Nian succeeded to the throne; in the fourth year, he was convicted of incest with his full sister, abolished as king, exiled to Fangling, and given one hundred households.

cells.content: 廣宗元始二年四月丁酉，王如意以孝王玄孫之子紹封，七年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Guangzong: Yuanshi second year fourth month Dingyou day, King Ruyi succeeded as Xiao King Xuansun's son; seventh year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Guangzong: On the Dingyou day of the fourth month in the second year of Yuanshi, King Ruyi succeeded as the son of Xiao King Xuansun; in the seventh year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

sentences.zh: 右孝文三人。

translations.literal: Above, Xiaowen three.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Xiaowen's three kings.

sentences.zh: 齊、城陽、兩濟北、濟南、菑川、膠西、膠東、趙、河間、淮南、衡山十二人隨父，凡十五人。

translations.literal: Qi, Chengyang, two Jibei, Jinan, Zichuan, Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Zhao, Hejian, Huainan, Hengshan twelve following their father, total fifteen people.
translations.idiomatic: Qi, Chengyang, the two Jibei, Jinan, Zichuan, Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Zhao, Hejian, Huainan, and Hengshan - twelve kings following their father, making a total of fifteen people.

cells.content: 河間獻王德
cells.literal: Hejian Xian King De.
cells.idiomatic: Hejian Xian King De.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 二年三月甲寅立，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: Established second year third month Jia Yin day; died after twenty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Yin day of the third month in the second year; died after twenty-six years.

cells.content: 元光六年，共王不周嗣，四年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanguang sixth year, Gong King Buzhou succeeded; died after four years.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Yuanguang, King Gong Buzhou succeeded to the throne; died after four years.

cells.content: 元朔四年，剛王基嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo fourth year, Gang King Ji succeeded; died after twelve years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanshuo, King Gang Ji succeeded to the throne; died after twelve years.

cells.content: 元鼎四年，頃王緩嗣，十七年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanding fourth year, Qing King Huan succeeded; died after seventeen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Yuanding, King Qing Huan succeeded to the throne; died after seventeen years.

cells.content: 天漢四年，孝王慶嗣，四十三年薨。
cells.literal: Tianhan fourth year, Xiao King Qing succeeded; died after forty-three years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Tianhan, King Xiao Qing succeeded to the throne; died after forty-three years.

cells.content: 五鳳四年，王元嗣，十七年，建昭元年，坐殺人，廢遷房陵。
cells.literal: Wufeng fourth year, King Yuan succeeded; seventeenth year, Jianzhao first year, convicted of murder, abolished and moved to Fangling.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Wufeng, King Yuan succeeded to the throne; in the seventeenth year, during the first year of Jianzhao, he was convicted of murder, abolished as king, and exiled to Fangling.

cells.content: 臨江哀王閼
cells.literal: Linjiang Ai King Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Linjiang Ai King Yan.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅立，三年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Established third month Jia Yin day; died after three years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Yin day of the third month; died after three years with no heir.

cells.content: 魯共王餘
cells.literal: Lu Gong King Yu.
cells.idiomatic: Lu Gong King Yu.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，立為淮陽王，二年，徙魯，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Third month Jia Yin day, established as Huaiyang King; second year, moved to Lu, died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Jia Yin day of the third month, he was established as Huaiyang King; in the second year, he was moved to Lu, and died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 元朔元年，安王光嗣，四十年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo first year, An King Guang succeeded; died after forty years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yuanshuo, King An Guang succeeded to the throne; died after forty years.

cells.literal: Houyuan first year, Xiao King Qingji succeeded; died after thirty-seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Houyuan, King Xiao Qingji succeeded to the throne; died after thirty-seven years.

cells.content: 甘露三年，頃王封嗣，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Ganlu third year, Qing King Feng succeeded; died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Ganlu, King Qing Feng succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 陽朔二年，文王晳嗣，十九年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Yangshuo second year, Wen King Xi succeeded; died after nineteen years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yangshuo, King Wen Xi succeeded to the throne; died after nineteen years with no heir.

cells.content: 江都易王非
cells.literal: Jiangdu Yi King Fei.
cells.idiomatic: Jiangdu Yi King Fei.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，立為汝南王，二年，徙江都，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Third month Jia Yin day, established as Runan King; second year, moved to Jiangdu, died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Jia Yin day of the third month, he was established as Runan King; in the second year, he was moved to Jiangdu, and died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 元朔二年，王建嗣，六年，元狩二年，謀反，自殺。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo second year, King Jian succeeded; sixth year, Yuanshou second year, plotted rebellion, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshuo, King Jian succeeded to the throne; in the sixth year, during the second year of Yuanshou, he plotted rebellion and committed suicide.

cells.content: 廣世元始二年四月丁酉，王宮以易王庶孫盱眙侯子紹封，五年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Guangshi: Yuanshi second year fourth month Dingyou day, King Gong succeeded as Yi King Shusun Xuyi Marquis's son; fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Guangshi: On the Dingyou day of the fourth month in the second year of Yuanshi, King Gong succeeded as the son of Yi King Shusun's Xuyi Marquis; in the fifth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 趙敬肅王彭祖
cells.literal: Zhao Jing Su King Pengzu.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao Jing Su King Pengzu.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 二月甲寅，立為廣川王，四年，徙趙，六十三年薨。
cells.literal: Second month Jia Yin day, established as Guangchuan King; fourth year, moved to Zhao, died after sixty-three years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Jia Yin day of the second month, he was established as Guangchuan King; in the fourth year, he was moved to Zhao, and died after sixty-three years.

cells.content: 征和元年，頃王昌嗣，十九年薨。
cells.literal: Zhenghe first year, Qing King Chang succeeded; died after nineteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Zhenghe, King Qing Chang succeeded to the throne; died after nineteen years.

cells.content: 本始元年，懷王尊嗣，五年薨。
cells.literal: Benshi first year, Huai King Zun succeeded; died after five years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Benshi, King Huai Zun succeeded to the throne; died after five years.

cells.content: 長沙定王發
cells.literal: Changsha Ding King Fa.
cells.idiomatic: Changsha Ding King Fa.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅立，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Established third month Jia Yin day; died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jia Yin day of the third month; died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 元朔二年，戴王庸嗣，二十七年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshuo second year, Dai King Yong succeeded; died after twenty-seven years.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshuo, King Dai Yong succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-seven years.

cells.content: 天漢元年，頃王附朐嗣，十七年薨。
cells.literal: Tianhan first year, Qing King Fuqu succeeded; died after seventeen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Tianhan, King Qing Fuqu succeeded to the throne; died after seventeen years.

cells.content: 始元四年，剌王建德嗣，三十四年薨。
cells.literal: Shiyuan fourth year, La King Jiande succeeded; died after thirty-four years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Shiyuan, King La Jiande succeeded to the throne; died after thirty-four years.

cells.content: 黃龍元年，煬王旦嗣，二年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Huanglong first year, Yang King Dan succeeded; died after two years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Huanglong, King Yang Dan succeeded to the throne; died after two years with no heir.

cells.content: 膠西于王端
cells.literal: Jiaoxi Yu King Duan.
cells.idiomatic: Jiaoxi Yu King Duan.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三年六月乙巳立，四十七年，元封三年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Established third year sixth month Yisi day; forty-seventh year, Yuanfeng third year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the sixth month in the third year; in the forty-seventh year, during the third year of Yuanfeng, he died with no heir.

cells.content: 中山靖王勝
cells.literal: Zhongshan Jing King Sheng.
cells.idiomatic: Zhongshan Jing King Sheng.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 六月乙巳立，四十二年薨。
cells.literal: Established sixth month Yisi day; died after forty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the sixth month; died after forty-two years.

cells.content: 元鼎五年，哀王昌嗣，二年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanding fifth year, Ai King Chang succeeded; died after two years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Yuanding, King Ai Chang succeeded to the throne; died after two years.

cells.content: 元封元年，㐄王昆侈嗣，二十一年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanfeng first year, Ju King Kunchi succeeded; died after twenty-one years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yuanfeng, King Ju Kunchi succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-one years.

cells.content: 征和四年，頃王輔嗣，三年薨。
cells.literal: Zhenghe fourth year, Qing King Fu succeeded; died after three years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Zhenghe, King Qing Fu succeeded to the throne; died after three years.

cells.content: 始元元年，憲王福嗣，十七年薨。
cells.literal: Shiyuan first year, Xian King Fu succeeded; died after seventeen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Shiyuan, King Xian Fu succeeded to the throne; died after seventeen years.

cells.content: 地節元年，懷王脩嗣，十五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Dijie first year, Huai King Xiu succeeded; died after fifteen years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Dijie, King Huai Xiu succeeded to the throne; died after fifteen years with no heir.

cells.content: 廣德鴻嘉二年八月，夷王雲客以懷王從父弟子紹封，一年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Guangde: Hongjia second year eighth month, Yi King Yunkai succeeded as Huai King Congfu disciple; died after one year, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Guangde: In the eighth month of the second year of Hongjia, King Yi Yunkai succeeded as Huai King's paternal cousin's disciple; died after one year with no heir.

cells.content: 膠東王
cells.literal: Jiaodong King.
cells.idiomatic: Jiaodong King.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 四年四月乙巳立，四年為皇太子。
cells.literal: Established fourth year fourth month Yisi day; fourth year became crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month in the fourth year; in the fourth year, he became crown prince.

cells.content: 臨江愍王榮
cells.literal: Linjiang Min King Rong.
cells.idiomatic: Linjiang Min King Rong.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 七年十一月己酉，以故皇太子立，三年，坐侵廟壖地為宮，自殺。
cells.literal: Established seventh year eleventh month Jiyou day as former crown prince; third year, convicted of encroaching on temple grounds to build palace, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Jiyou day of the eleventh month in the seventh year as the former crown prince; in the third year, he was convicted of encroaching on temple grounds to build a palace and committed suicide.

cells.content: 廣川惠王越
cells.literal: Guangchuan Hui King Yue.
cells.idiomatic: Guangchuan Hui King Yue.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 中二年四月乙巳立，十二年薨。
cells.literal: Established middle second year fourth month Yisi day; died after twelve years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month in the middle second year; died after twelve years.

cells.content: 建元五年，繆王齊嗣，四十五年薨。
cells.literal: Jianyuan fifth year, Miao King Qi succeeded; died after forty-five years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Jianyuan, King Miao Qi succeeded to the throne; died after forty-five years.

cells.content: 征和二年，王去嗣，二十二年，本始四年，坐亨姬不道，廢徙上庸，予邑百戶。
cells.literal: Zhenghe second year, King Qu succeeded; twenty-second year, Benshi fourth year, convicted of murdering concubine in unrighteous manner, abolished and moved to Shangyong, given one hundred households.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Zhenghe, King Qu succeeded to the throne; in the twenty-second year, during the fourth year of Benshi, he was convicted of murdering a concubine in an unrighteous manner, abolished as king, exiled to Shangyong, and given one hundred households.

cells.content: 膠東康王寄
cells.literal: Jiaodong Kang King Ji.
cells.idiomatic: Jiaodong Kang King Ji.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 四月乙巳立，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Established fourth month Yisi day; died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month; died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 元狩三年，哀王賢嗣，十四年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanshou third year, Ai King Xian succeeded; died after fourteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanshou, King Ai Xian succeeded to the throne; died after fourteen years.

cells.content: 元封五年，戴王通平嗣，二十四年薨。
cells.literal: Yuanfeng fifth year, Dai King Tongping succeeded; died after twenty-four years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Yuanfeng, King Dai Tongping succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-four years.

cells.content: 始元五年，頃王音嗣，五十四年薨。
cells.literal: Shiyuan fifth year, Qing King Yin succeeded; died after fifty-four years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Shiyuan, King Qing Yin succeeded to the throne; died after fifty-four years.

cells.content: 河平元年，恭王授嗣，十四年薨。
cells.literal: Heping first year, Gong King Shou succeeded; died after fourteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Heping, King Gong Shou succeeded to the throne; died after fourteen years.

cells.content: 永始三年，王殷嗣，二十三年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Yongshi third year, King Yin succeeded; twenty-third year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yongshi, King Yin succeeded to the throne; in the twenty-third year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 清河哀王乘
cells.literal: Qinghe Ai King Cheng.
cells.idiomatic: Qinghe Ai King Cheng.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 中三年三月丁酉立，十二年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Established middle third year third month Dingyou day; died after twelve years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Dingyou day of the third month in the middle third year; died after twelve years with no heir.

cells.content: 常山憲王舜
cells.literal: Changshan Xian King Shun.
cells.idiomatic: Changshan Xian King Shun.

cells.content: 景帝子。
cells.literal: Jing Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 中五年三月丁巳立，三十二年薨。
cells.literal: Established middle fifth year third month Dingsi day; died after thirty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Dingsi day of the third month in the middle fifth year; died after thirty-two years.

cells.content: 元鼎三年，王勃嗣，坐憲王喪服姦，廢徙房陵。
cells.literal: Yuanding third year, King Bo succeeded; convicted of incest during Xian King's mourning period, abolished and moved to Fangling.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year of Yuanding, King Bo succeeded to the throne; he was convicted of incest during Xian King's mourning period, abolished as king, and exiled to Fangling.

sentences.zh: 右孝景十四人。

translations.literal: Above, Xiaojing fourteen.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Xiaojing's fourteen kings.

sentences.zh: 楚、濟川、濟東、山陽、濟陰五人隨父，凡十九人。

translations.literal: Chu, Jichuan, Jidong, Shanyang, Jiyin five following their father, total nineteen people.
translations.idiomatic: Chu, Jichuan, Jidong, Shanyang, and Jiyin - five kings following their father, making a total of nineteen people.

cells.content: 齊懷王閎
cells.literal: Qi Huai King Hong.
cells.idiomatic: Qi Huai King Hong.

cells.content: 武帝子。
cells.literal: Wu Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 元狩六年四月乙巳立，八年，元封元年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Established Yuanshou sixth year fourth month Yisi day; eighth year, Yuanfeng first year died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month in the sixth year of Yuanshou; in the eighth year, during the first year of Yuanfeng, he died with no heir.

cells.content: 燕剌王旦
cells.literal: Yan La King Dan.
cells.idiomatic: Yan La King Dan.

cells.content: 武帝子。
cells.literal: Wu Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 四月乙巳立，三十七年，元鳳元年，坐謀反，自殺。
cells.literal: Established fourth month Yisi day; thirty-seventh year, Yuanfeng first year, convicted of plotting rebellion, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month; in the thirty-seventh year, during the first year of Yuanfeng, he was convicted of plotting rebellion and committed suicide.

cells.content: 廣陽本始元年五月，頃王建以剌王子紹封，二十九年薨。
cells.literal: Guangyang: Benshi first year fifth month, Qing King Jian succeeded as La King's son; died after twenty-nine years.
cells.idiomatic: Guangyang: In the fifth month of the first year of Benshi, King Qing Jian succeeded as La King's son; died after twenty-nine years.

cells.content: 初元五年，穆王舜嗣，二十一年薨。
cells.literal: Chuyuan fifth year, Mu King Shun succeeded; died after twenty-one years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Chuyuan, King Mu Shun succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-one years.

cells.content: 陽朔二年，思王璜嗣，二十一年薨。
cells.literal: Yangshuo second year, Si King Huang succeeded; died after twenty-one years.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yangshuo, King Si Huang succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-one years.

cells.content: 建平四年，王嘉嗣，十二年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。

cells.content: 廣陵厲王胥
cells.literal: Gangling Li King Xu.
cells.idiomatic: Gangling Li King Xu.

cells.content: 武帝子。
cells.literal: Wu Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 四月乙巳立，六十三年，五鳳四年，坐祝詛上，自殺。
cells.literal: Established fourth month Yisi day; sixty-third year, Wufeng fourth year, convicted of cursing the emperor, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yisi day of the fourth month; in the sixty-third year, during the fourth year of Wufeng, he was convicted of cursing the emperor and committed suicide.

cells.content: 初元二年三月壬申，孝王霸以厲王子紹封，十三年薨。
cells.literal: Chuyuan second year third month Renshen day, Xiao King Ba succeeded as Li King's son; died after thirteen years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Renshen day of the third month in the second year of Chuyuan, King Xiao Ba succeeded as Li King's son; died after thirteen years.

cells.content: 建昭五年，共王意嗣，十三年薨。
cells.literal: Jianzhao fifth year, Gong King Yi succeeded; died after thirteen years.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Jianzhao, King Gong Yi succeeded to the throne; died after thirteen years.

cells.content: 建始二年，哀王護嗣，十五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Jianshi second year, Ai King Hu succeeded; died after fifteen years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Jianshi, King Ai Hu succeeded to the throne; died after fifteen years with no heir.

cells.content: 昌邑哀王髆
cells.literal: Changyi Ai King Bo.
cells.idiomatic: Changyi Ai King Bo.

cells.content: 武帝子。
cells.literal: Wu Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 天漢四年六月乙丑立，十一年薨。
cells.literal: Established Tianhan fourth year sixth month Yichou day; died after eleven years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yichou day of the sixth month in the fourth year of Tianhan; died after eleven years.

cells.content: 始元元年，王賀嗣，十二年，徵為昭帝後，立二十七日，以行淫亂，廢歸故國，予邑三千戶。
cells.literal: Shiyuan first year, King He succeeded; twelfth year, summoned to be Empress Dowager Zhao's heir, reigned twenty-seven days, convicted of licentious conduct, abolished and returned to his former kingdom, given three thousand households.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Shiyuan, King He succeeded to the throne; in the twelfth year, he was summoned to become Empress Dowager Zhao's heir, reigned for twenty-seven days, was convicted of licentious conduct, abolished as emperor, returned to his former kingdom, and given three thousand households.

sentences.zh: 右孝武四人。

translations.literal: Above, Xiaowu four.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Xiaowu's four kings.

sentences.zh: 六安、真定、泗水、平干四人隨父，凡八人。

translations.literal: Liuan, Zhending, Sishui, Pingqian four following their father, total eight people.
translations.idiomatic: Liuan, Zhending, Sishui, and Pingqian - four kings following their father, making a total of eight people.

cells.content: 淮陽憲王欽
cells.literal: Huaiyang Xian King Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Huaiyang Xian King Qin.

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: Xuan Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Xuan.

cells.content: 元康三年四月丙子立，三十六年薨。
cells.literal: Yuankang third year fourth month Bingzi day established; died after thirty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Bingzi day of the fourth month in the third year of Yuankang; died after thirty-six years.

cells.content: 河平二年，文王玄嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: Heping second year, Wen King Xuan succeeded; died after twenty-six years.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Heping, King Wen Xuan succeeded to the throne; died after twenty-six years.

cells.content: 元壽二年，王縯嗣，十九年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: Yuanshou second year, King Ying succeeded; nineteenth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted to duke, next year abolished.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year of Yuanshou, King Ying succeeded to the throne; in the nineteenth year, Wang Mang usurped the throne, demoted him to duke, and abolished the kingdom the following year.

cells.content: 東平思王宇
cells.literal: Dongping Si King Yu.
cells.idiomatic: Dongping Si King Yu.

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: Xuan Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Xuan.

cells.content: 甘露二年十月乙亥立，三十二年薨。
cells.literal: Ganlu second year tenth month Yihai day established; died after thirty-two years.
cells.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the Yihai day of the tenth month in the second year of Ganlu; died after thirty-two years.

cells.content: 鴻嘉元年，煬王雲嗣，十六年，建平三年，坐祝詛上，自殺。
cells.literal: Hongjia first year, Yang King Yun succeeded; sixteenth year, Jianping third year, convicted of cursing the emperor, committed suicide.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Hongjia, King Yang Yun succeeded to the throne; in the sixteenth year, during the third year of Jianping, he was convicted of cursing the emperor and committed suicide.

cells.content: 元始元年二月丙辰，王開明嗣，立五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Yuanshi first year second month Bingchen day, King Kaiming succeeded; reigned five years died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day of the second month in the first year of Yuanshi, King Kaiming succeeded to the throne; reigned for five years and died with no heir.

cells.content: 楚孝王囂
cells.literal: Chu Xiao King Xiao.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Xiao King Xiao.

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: Xuan Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Xuan.

cells.content: 十月乙亥，立為定陶王，四年，徙楚，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: Tenth month Yihai day, established as Dingtao King; fourth year, moved to Chu, died after twenty-eight years.
cells.idiomatic: On the Yihai day of the tenth month, he was established as Dingtao King; in the fourth year, he was moved to Chu, and died after twenty-eight years.

cells.content: 陽朔元年，懷王芳嗣，一年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Yangshuo first year, Huai King Fang succeeded; died after one year, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of Yangshuo, King Huai Fang succeeded to the throne; died after one year with no heir.

cells.content: 中山哀王竟
cells.literal: Zhongshan Ai King Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Zhongshan Ai King Jing.

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: Xuan Di's son.
cells.idiomatic: Son of Emperor Xuan.

cells.content: 初元二年二月丁巳，立為清河王，五年，徙中山王，十三年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: Chuyuan second year second month Dingsi day, established as Qinghe King; fifth year, moved to Zhongshan King, died after thirteen years, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day of the second month in the second year of Chuyuan, he was established as Qinghe King; in the fifth year, he was moved to become Zhongshan King, died after thirteen years with no heir.

sentences.zh: 右孝宣四人。

translations.literal: Above, Xiaoxuan four.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Xiaoxuan's four kings.

sentences.zh: 燕王繼絕，高密隨父，凡六人。

translations.literal: Yan King continued the extinct line, Gaomi followed his father, total six people.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan King continued an extinct line, Gaomi followed his father, making a total of six people.

sentences.zh: 右孝元二人。

translations.literal: Above, Xiaoyuan two.
translations.idiomatic: Above are Xiaoyuan's two kings.

sentences.zh: 廣陵繼絕，凡三人。

translations.literal: Gangling continued the extinct line, total three people.
translations.idiomatic: Gangling continued an extinct line, making a total of three people.

sentences.zh: 孝成時河間、廣德、定陶三國，孝哀時廣平一國，孝平時東平、中山、廣德、廣世、廣宗五國，皆繼絕。

translations.literal: During Xiaocheng's time Hejian, Guangde, Dingtao three kingdoms; during Xiaoai's time Guangping one kingdom; during Xiaoping's time Dongping, Zhongshan, Guangde, Guangshi, Guangzong five kingdoms, all continued extinct lines.
translations.idiomatic: During Emperor Cheng's reign: Hejian, Guangde, and Dingtao - three kingdoms. During Emperor Ai's reign: Guangping - one kingdom. During Emperor Ping's reign: Dongping, Zhongshan, Guangde, Guangshi, and Guangzong - five kingdoms. All of these continued extinct royal lines.
